thread.title: Visit an immersive work by Jean Dubuffet in the Centre Pompidou's permanent collections
thread.title_full: Visit an immersive work by Jean Dubuffet in the Centre Pompidou's permanent collections

author: Margot de Sortiraparis
title: Visit an immersive work by Jean Dubuffet in the Centre Pompidou's permanent collections
text:
The permanent collections of the Centre Georges Pompidou are full of nuggets. From the birth of modern art with Marcel Duchamp's first works, to the DADA movement, surrealism, cubism and other artistic movements of the 20th and 21st centuries... On the4th floor, one of the most curious works to discover is certainly Winter Garden, by French artist Jean Dubuffet.
Particularly famous in the Île-de-France region for having created all the works that make up the Closerie Falbala, near Périgny, in the Val-de-Marne département , or the Tour aux figures, which dominates the Île Saint-Germain park, Jean Dubuffet is most notably exhibited at the Centre Georges Pompidou. This work is the Winter Garden, an immersive work painted entirely in white with black motifs. The floor is dented, the walls have a shape that is far from regulation... Designed in the style of a den, Jardin d'Hiver is covered withHoulourpe, a word coined by the artist himself to design the black geometric patterns that line each of his works.
The work invites you to sit back, read, take your time or simply browse through it: to do so, you'll need an admission ticket for the Centre Pompidou's permanent collections (full price €15, reduced price €12 - under 25s are free!).
Dates and Opening Time
From January 23, 2025 to December 31, 2028
Location
Center Pompidou
centre pompidou
75004 Paris 4
Access
Metro line 11 "Rambuteau" station
Official website
www.centrepompidou.fr
